page.title: 01COLMWORTH
page.content:
The village is built amongst rolling clay countryside in the north east of Bedfordshire. Like many others in the area, it spreads out over some considerable distance with much of the building being in narrow plots alongside the roads.
There are four 'ends', Church End, Chapel End, Roothams Green and finally The City. The latter with the interesting name is thought to have Huguenot connections.
The church was built in the early 13th century by the local landowner, Sir Gerard Braybrook in honour of his French wife. It is dedicated to the patron saint of France, St.Denys.
